field.name: summary
field.value: ViewEngineBase.IsTemplateForJSGeneration(String templateName) returns true for a templateName with an incorrect extension

field.name: description
field.value:
Some pages started to come out wrong after Ken Egozi's 'first' patch as they started to come as javascript.
The root of the problem was that IsTemplateForJSGeneration was returning true if the templateName parameter contained ANY extension, not just the right kind. That is common in our system notably when some view names come from the database.
Attached is a patch that fix that, with a new TestFixture (ViewEngineBaseTestCase), covering the four basic situations this method should handle.
All Monorail tests pass with the changes
